YTAY1Nlme6Dvz_0zprcZ7Q.text: The environment, prices, and food was great! My boyfriend got the moist beef brisket and I got the pulled pork sandwich. Both choices were very delicious and juicy and the addition of the house sauce was just the right touch. Definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. PULLED PORK Sandwich
Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. Beef BRISKET, MOIST (1/2 LB.)

lw6AFbG_kYidk65JXsDnLQ.text: Solid 3.5 stars for Rudy's! I was in town just for a couple days, and being that this place was right across from my hotel made it super convenient to stop in. I was in a slight rush so didn't really get to check out the country store portion, but this place certainly caters to "quick food" considering it's not a sit down restaurant. Get in line, order at the counter. Even grab a beer or soda from the large ice bucket as you maneuver to the counter.  My order of 1/2 chicken, slaw, and a beer came out to around $13? In comparison to other BBQ joints I've been to, this was a steal!   Notes: Good for convenience, and quick Plenty of food, and great pricing Most side dishes were in the fridge before you get to the counter...if you want one, grab one before you get there Slaw was just OK. Nothing special. I was glad it wasn't overly dressed 1/2 chicken was good. Skin was super soggy which was a little sad but overall flavor was fine...had a nice smoke to it. Just watch out for bones.  Their house BBQ is quite tasty and had a nice kick to it They will give you 4 slices of bread with your meal if you'd like Bar with fixens to the side, and they even had ziplock baggies for our to  go orders!  All in all I was pleased.

HP7oODiUC9PmT1SKnWsfBA.text: My boyfriend and his mom have been raving about this place for months, and it was our first stop when we got into town.  They were particularly excited about the smoked turkey.  I'm one of those people that likes turkey on holidays, but it's not all that exciting of a meat, you know?  Dear lord, that was the most AMAZING turkey I've ever had in my life!  It was moist, tender, smoky and the rub was delicious.  I ended up buying a bottle of the turkey rub to bring home.    In all fairness, I did try other meats too.  The moist brisket and pork loin were also awesome.  We ate 4 meals here in 6 days, that's how good it is.  My tummy is growling as I'm typing this and I'm cursing the fact that I live so far away from this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. BBQ sandwiches
Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. Moist brisket

3LVndv-LlW9BQkLFOHls3w.text: I'm not a BBQ person. But when it's 110 degrees and I don't want to fire up the stove for over an hour to bake a potato, I go to Rudy's! I get a funny look when I tell them no meat on my potato! They are delicious and taste a little smokey. I also like Rudy's cole slaw. It's not heavily doused with a mayo dressing. I like to grab stuff from the condiment bar too, pickles, jalapenos and peppers. Yes, vegans can eat at a BBQ restaurant.

RR3DBuiwF6cjCfHpsv3UVA.text: Best Brisket I've ever had!!!  They have the best Brisket, I've ever had without question! I also got beans, cream of corn, and a jalapeno sausage all were excellent! The brisket was juicy and bursting with great flavor!

jIgWHldAdDrKnQsgC08wAw.text: Our first time in Chandler and we came here for dinner. We enjoyed the atmosphere and the food was great. I had beef ribs that were cooked perfectly.  It was just the right amount of food too. Prices are great for BBQ!! Wish there was a Rudy's in CA.

JFCFDFmmRacYnLWWEqceRg.text: I was told beforehand that Rudy's is amazing and that I had to pay a visit while I was in Arizona.  I think this caused me to set my expectations so high that when I finally did eat at Rudy's, I was expecting to be absolutely blown away.  To be quite honest, I was disappointed and was not all that impressed.  Little Miss BBQ is hands down still the #1 BBQ place in Arizona in my book.  Rudy's is not a difficult place to find since the restaurant is tan, yellow, and red.  The place is spacious with plenty of parking, plenty of outdoor seating as well and indoor seating.  There is a little store inside the place to the left where you can buy the BBQ sauces, candy, wine, Rudy's shirts, drinks, etc.    As far as the actual restaurant goes, if you have never been to Rudy's before, it is basically set up like a school cafeteria.  You get in line to purchase your food at the counter.  While in line and heading toward the counter, you can grab bottled drinks, sides in containers from the fridge, and etc.  Once you have reached the counter, that is where you will order your main dishes and sides.  If you have never been to Rudy's before or are undecided on what to get, feel free to ask for samples!  The customer service that we received at the counter was excellent and very pleasant.  After sampling different items, my bf and I ended up ordering brisket moist, spicy chop with sauce, ribs, jalapeno sausages, and potato salad to share.  All of our food was placed in a plastic tray/crate thingie magig that you normally use to store bottled sodas.    Once you have your food, you go and find yourself a table to sit down and eat.  From here on out, everything is self serve.  There are stations where you can grab napkins and white butcher paper which acts as your "plate."  You just spread it out on the table, place some food on there and feast!    On each of the tables are Rudy's BBQ sauces which are gluten free!  There's a spicy sauce and a mild sauce for the sissies who cannot handle spicy sauces.  The sauce is really called the Sissy sauce!  Don't worry though, the spicy BBQ sauce didn't really have any heat so you should definitely try it out without the fear of burning your tongue off.  The BBQ sauces did not impress me.  It tasted just like any regular BBQ sauce that you can get at a store.  There was nothing special about the sauces.  The brisket moist I'm assuming is supposed to be moist since the word is in the name but it was not moist.  In fact, it was more on the dry side and not tender.  I drowned the brisket in the BBQ sauce just to moisten it up a bit.  This was disappointing considering brisket is the number one item that I order at BBQ joints.  The spicy chop with sauce was good and I think it would taste good in between hamburger buns.  The ribs were okay.  The jalapeno sausages were good flavor wise since I like spicy foods, but once again, the sausages were more on the dry side.  As far as the sides go, the potato salad, coleslaw, and etc. all tasted like average sides that you can buy in large quantities at the store.  Nothing special about the sides.    As mentioned before, it is self serve after you get your food and start eating.  This means that after you are done eating, you have to clean up after yourself before you leave.   Overall, the customer service was excellent, the prices average, and the food was just okay.  I wouldn't come back to Rudy's unless this was the only BBQ joint that was open and I was desperately craving BBQ.  There are way better BBQ places out there that I would go to first.

photos.caption: Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. Seating.
Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States

6oysUlAZlOJ6-nxYE6tWtQ.text: So I've been back a few times since my original visit and I have to say that this place has really grown on me.  The motif of picnic tables and variety of BBQ sauces is a nice option and the simpleness of this place is nice.  I like the nice smoky smell as you walk in and they will give you samples if you want to try something new.  I've recently discovered the pulled pork and sausages which are really moist and juicy.  Can't believe I just used those two words to describe food, but I don't know what else to say.  The ribs are also worth trying and I don't know anywhere else around here where you can order a Shiner Bock off the menu.  Prices are also pretty good.  You can have a filling meal for two for under $30 with drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. Simple and straightforward menu
Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. Outside parking

-wbsjt4FdZaS1hi5xLRePw.text: Walked in as new customers and were immediately greeted.  Couldn't tell who did it but nevertheless!  Went to the counter to order and a gal offered to help us.  We walked over and she gave us some samples to taste to figure out what we wanted.  The turkey was AMAZING!!  Never had such moist smoked turkey before!  Also got brisket and sausage.  Everything had great flavor and we would definitely come back if ever in Chandler.

fS4t9u6knU7SgzIEcCV8-g.text: First time here and I wouldn't normally think turkey, however a friend recommended it. The brisket is good but the turkey was the best I ever had!!

3OQf0dTCuLtddXuXYhGUlg.text: I've been to this place several times before, and never have I had a meal that was as dry as the one I had tonight. I got a half pound of pork ribs which were heavily peppered and very dry. We also got 4 moist brisket sandwiches. Two out of four of them were dry. We usually finish our entire meal, but it was so dry we couldn't. It was a waste of $35. I don't think we'll be going to this location again.

VDBmNnkVGQRkqxq8TQ0pKw.text: I am new to the area - 2 months new - and have already been to Rudy's five times!  Across those five visits I have had the pleasure of having some of the smoked turkey, brisket, pulled pork, new potatoes, cream corn, coleslaw, potato salad, and beans.  The meat has consistently been great - its quite tender!  Personally I love the cream corn because its unique and reminds me of my grandma's back in the day.  Unfortunately, I can't rave about the potato salad though as it seems like regular deli made or the kind sold in the plastic container at the grocery store.  The coleslaw is the exact kind I like, but could use a little more flare - like more horseradish!  All in all I like to eat at Rudy's and I like that its so close to my new home!  I'm sure trip number 6 is right around the corner...

WNBhcRVSZReHgOSWmHD9KQ.text: I'm a Texas boy originally from Houston... My wife and I were looking for some good meat and bbq. We found it. This place has bomb brisket. My fam likes to smoke brisket and have family competitions.... but wow this brisket was so tender and moist. Melted in my mouth. Loved their peppery and Smokey bbq sauces too. We will be back. Thanks to the friendly staff too. They were very helpful explaining the a-la-carte menu.

LLR1nFPlGGyhsgT0qf71MA.text: Meats are over-smoked, especially the brisket, almost overpowering with smoky flavor.  The corn they serve is no better than cattle corn served up at feed lots.  Green chile stew is good but probably too spicy for the average palate.  If you're going to eat here, eat here.  Don't take it home, it loses what quality it has the minute you walk out the door.  Service is always good so no problem there.

HGNjM2SFLyzNjf2Nso2Csg.text: Since we're remodeling our kitchen we decided to give this place another try last night. My wife has been craving some pulled pork, and usually that's something I would make at home in my smoker. Well she liked the pulled pork sandwich I got her, but that was mainly because she got to use favorite Sweet Baby Ray's Sweet and Spicy sauce on it. She tried both their sweet and spicy sauces and didn't care for them. That's one good thing about this place is that they don't sauce their meats, so you can put your favorite sauce on it.   I had a half of a Chicken, and a 1/2 pound of the their pork loin. The Chicken was cooked very well. It was nice and juicy, but it had way too much of their dry rub on it. Their rub has a lot of cayenne pepper and coriander in it, and it's got a bit of a bitter taste to it. I typically like very spicy foods, but just not their combination. There was no taste of smoke in the meat at all. I'm guessing that they use oak in the smoker, which doesn't have much of a flavor.   The sliced pork loin had a nice smoke ring on it, but again all you tasted was the rub. There was no smoke flavor at all. The pork was pretty dry, which is common with pork loin because of the lack of fat in the meat. When I smoke pork loins I always brine them first to add flavor, and compensate for the lack of fat.   I still can't say that I like the food here, but it was better than when I tried them just after they opened. I guess that this place is popular among those who don't smoke their own food, and don't know what good smoked meat can taste like. It's certainly popular, because the parking lot at this place is always full. I still prefer Dave's BBQ if I am going to go out for BBQ. They have a better sauce selection, and at least you can taste some smoke in their meats. They also don't overdo the rub on their meat with a strong flavor that some people may not like. That's just my opinion.

pdFcxJRRZbxZ-YoDh3B4Xw.text: First, I love Rudy's in general, so don't take my review of 3 stars as an indication of bad food (it's not!). However, I feel like I have to review since I am from Texas, and this AZ location may not know about prime rib...  Sorry guys, I know you're trying hard, but you can't cut 1/2 pound of prime rib with maybe - and I'm being generous here - 80% of which is fat fatty fat-fat. Side note, sorry for making everyone do math, but that equates to maybe 0.40 lbs of fat for the 0.5 lbs of meat....so 0.10 pounds of meat is what I payed for....apparently.   Naturally, I love America, so I love some meat (\m/), but if you're going to charge by pound for fat only, do it in Missippi or Alabama where no one will notice.

ufs8_bgRD2Ol6qNhYqYDkw.text: I am always a little leery about BBQ places because I was raised by a dad who could bbq like nobody's business and then I married a man that is just as amazing at the grill. Rudy's was the 1st time I have ever had pork ribs that have tasted as great as I can get at home. Most restaurants either over-cook, or try to cook the ribs too fast, or whatever that makes them have that crunchy, burnt-like texture. Not this place. My husband and I were beyond impressed.  They also do things a little differently here. It's like being at a family bbq where everyone lines up for their food at an assembly line. You get in line, grab a bottled drink out of the huge ice bucket if you want one, move down further and grab potato salad or pie out of the cooler. Finally you buy your bbq items by weight - just pick out what you want. They give samples as well and don't make you feel like a hassle at all. You then get your condiments and seat yourself. Clean up after yourself is all they ask.  I also wanted to add that they make buttermilk pie. For anyone who hasn't tried this tasty treat, Rudy's makes them better than my mom can - and that's saying a lot.

VU6LJAmBgiz9rA7IRB5z9Q.text: I regularly buy 3-4 pounds of beef brisket from this location. The last time, I purchased prime rib instead of beef brisket to give it a try. It was not fresh with an odd taste as it was waiting for days. The texture was very firm and dry. It was very disappointing considering it has double the price compared to other items on the menu. We could not eat the most of it. I sent a complaint note thru their website, but they ignored. I am no longer purchasing bbq here.

-nY4sfJ2eDlqtvJgzAj52A.text: First contact in Lubbock TX. Glad they're expanding. Brisket is great as is their ribs and hot links. Cream corn is good to. Pecan pie is ordinary and could be much better. We'll be back.

8OhjJMzQO20a_6A-lUSZ-w.text: I first had Rudy's in San Antonio, Texas while visiting my husband.  It was the best barbeque I had ever had.  When they opened up the one in Chandler, my husband and I were overjoyed.  We stop by every time we go through Chandler.  We live in Tucson, so it is a treat for us.  And it is right off of I-10.   The people there are very courteous.  They are also extremely helpful.  The place is always clean, and they work really fast.  I am never dissatisfied when we visit.  It isn't as interactive as the San Antonio ones, but it works for the people out here.  I love it... My husband loves the moist brisket and beans.  I love the spicy chop.  My kids love the chicken.  And, my brother said the ribs are awesome.  We always grab some Rudy's sauce to bring home with us.  We don't get the sissy sauce like people we know.  A plus is that the sauce doesn't kill my stomach like most barbeque sauces.

gTQW8tDz1NZOcFXLyPURLA.text: This is a great place to get some good Bar-B-Q. It may be a chain but the staff is always friendly and they strive to be helpful when you're attempting to make that oh so important decision between the lean brisket, the pork loin or the turkey. You can't really go wrong with anything here. I often try to stop by any time I'm in Chandler.

0_mIEcLyJRLuWBWryzaULg.text: We were in the area and decided that bbq sounded good, I pulled up yelp and found this place with good reviews.  The building itself is really fun and innovative, I loved the whole feel and atmosphere.  All of the employees were friendly and seemed to be enjoying their jobs, which is always nice to see.    I'm going to keep this short and simple.  Come here for the meat and skimp on the sides.  I liked that they were willing to give you samples of the meat so you could pick what you liked the best; we ended up with both lean and moist beef brisket and pork ribs.  For sides we got corn on the cob, coleslaw and baked beans.  The corn almost ruined the experience for me.  I saw the woman pull a corn on the cob on a stick out of some container and pour two laddles of melted butter over it....sick, but that wasn't even the worst part about it.  Once we sat down to eat I decided to start the meal off with the corn, I took one bite and thought it tasted really odd.  Visually you could see this wasn't fresh.  I had my fiance take a bite of it and he got a really disgusted look on his face, looked at the bottom of the corn and showed me a huge brown ring.  They served ROTTEN corn.  Ugh!  Thankfully the meat was delicious and saved this place from a 1 star review.  The beans and coleslaw were both decent but tasted store bought.

Ylrcxkzmmgig9etoOSyfaQ.text: Tried it last Thursday . The brisket was juicy and moist. They had plenty of condiments including jalapenos.  The sauce was not too sweet or tangy . Price was reasonable.  Cold slaw was average

ZLFSyhiUrDGd22Uj4G-2MQ.text: I absolutely love Rudy's!!! I find myself craving this bbq and their AMAZING banana pudding!!!! They definitely earn five stars!!! I highly recommend their loaded baked potato with the jalapeno sausage!!! Mind. BLOWING!

QpQWsgDP8Tq3wyLzW8vv4A.text: Bring the family for some good country BBQ and great food.  The creamed corn is to die for!

photos.caption: Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. Great patio atmosphere.

abKQrKrNYSNfqbRmt1ve7w.text: For BBQ, this place is excellent.  T had been talking a lot of hype, so we went with my aunt when we were visiting Phoenix.  Her words verbatim:  "This is my kind of restaurant."  We got brisket, jalapeno sausage, pulled pork, ribs, cole slaw, corn on the cob, potatoes, and some bread.  A bucket of beer and we were set to go!  Everything was delicious, and it was a fun place to eat with communal picnic tables and self service everything.  Their sauces had great spice, or you could get sissy sauce if you wanted less heat.  I wish they had wet wipes though, it would have made the experience much less messy considering the amount of ribs we had.

NztB0g-OMaoE1rzlIJ-2ZA.text: Went here for lunch yesterday for the first time and I love this place!! the Brisket is out of this world. they give you samples to taste so you know what your getting before you order!! over all a great time!!!

xmcj-aksa-u7Rv7hBaXa9Q.text: Always a solid for good Q.  You know what you are going to get, good smoked meat and good sides.  Should have came here instead of Famous Dave's...

eF5FNq9C3355dtYHYtg3fA.text: Damn, this place is so good.....so good. Do yourself a favor and get some, or even six pounds of "brisket lean". You won't regret it. Everything else is great too, but who doesn't love perfectly flavored smoked brisket? Do it. Do it. Dooooo it.

lxo0fTL4prJs-1QdNX6yYw.text: Wanting to tuck in that napkin and just have a beer with plenty of slow roasted bark on your brisket, then this your place. Y'all come for picnic style and excellent BBQ. This is a meat lovers delight with a simple ambiance. Don't dress up unless jeans and boots are your style.

photos.caption: Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. Rudy&#39;s is hoppin&#39; tonight!!!

xvs83N8r4T9LSzWS9Lb61g.text: Originally I wanted to go to Speakeasy. I thought it would be a throwback to the 20's. Not even close to that BTW.  On to Rudy's which is pretty much next door, and we made a fantastic choice.  I had the Moist Brisket and my Partner had the Turkey Sandwhich. They both were awesome. Paired with the Rudy Beans and a Peach Cobbler that was great. I wish they had Ice Cream for the Cobbler.  While we were there a family of five sat next to us and had a BBQ picnic style meal. The setting is cool with the table layouts. If you enjoy beer (never been one to tip it back) you will enjoy the large beer troff they have. I am a firm believer that the BBQ sauce makes or breaks a place and this was nothing short of Fantastic. They have a spicy and a "Sissy" flavor, both very enjoyable. We were offered samples and I had a very difficult time choosing since they were all very good tasting.

11oPO-gqDAHgdam5WrV1Ew.text: Great Authentic BBQ!  My husband and I finally decided to check out Rudy's. It was beyond our expectations. The atmosphere is like a backyard BBQ at a friend's home. The seating is all picnic tables with bottle top openers and napkin holders all over the walls.   First about the ordering, it is just like ordering at a fast food counter but so far from fast food. We had to stand in a line but getting the food wasn't any longer than what we would experience at a sit down restaurant. You wait in line and can pick your drinks and sides along the way. Once you get to the counter you tell them if you want any hot sides and what kind of meat you want. They get it ready right there as you wait. The food comes out on wax paper and in a crate and the meat is being cut right where you can see it. It is a different format from any other restaurant I have been in but I liked it. The meat is put in front of you on a scale like at a butcher shop but it is already cooked.    I had the pulled pork sandwich and I could tell it was slow cooked to perfection. It doesn't come with BBQ sauce but there are two big jars at your table to add. My husband had the turkey sandwich and it looked like it was cut right off the bone. He said it was the best turkey sandwich he ever had. Nothing is done fancy there, it is all about the meat.   I will go back many more times.

KlznVYXCLDUYSzmnv8f68w.text: My new favorite spot! I love the experience and the BBQ is top notch!!!

XxlPWadm_wIZGvkrONlkuw.text: This may be the worst BBQ I have even had and I grew up on Memphis where it's a staple. I had a turkey sandwich and a brisket sandwich. They were not much bigger than a McDonald's cheeseburger. The turkey was ok but the brisket was just plain nasty. The only flavor I tasted was smoke, smoke and make smoke. Hair terrible. Maybe it was a bad day who knows

iGgMmAQV7B5lQqKloEZWCw.text: Food outstanding, service and food always good, love it!   BBQ is wonderful brisket to tender!

9FqZ5rtP0r9valU2vB2_XQ.text: ReDONKulous BBQ and atmosphere...all u could want in a traditional BBQ restaurant...worth the extra 30-40 min to get    There

photos.caption: Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. 1/2 lb moist brisket and baked beans #fire

VwhbefdFKX_51KfhhDRXMA.text: Awesome BBQ and extremely inexpensive. I'm not sure how they stay in business with prices so low. Their breakfast burritos are also fantastic. Did I mention the low prices????

ntOSu8LKO-XurTbGSbATkg.text: Awesome, first time here and had to come back the next day.  The green chile stew alone gets this place five stars. Unexpected, but this is one of the best soups/stews I have ever had in my life. It was kind of like a thicker posole. Throw some of their pulled pork in to take it to an even higher level. Gonna miss that back in NY.  The BBQ meats are all fantastic as well, my favorites were the lean brisket, the pulled pork, and the baby back ribs. Was surprised to find the lean brisket to be more flavorful than the moist brisket. Great smoke ring.  Very friendly staff, fun environment that isn't too smokey. Appreciated that I didn't spend the rest of the day smelling like smoke. Some people might like that though.  Anyway, highly recommend.

tptFOeNxzWzVXnocC-SiNg.text: Breakfast burrito YUM. Brisket, jalapeno sausage, potatoes, cheese (no eggs for me). LOVE.

TIAX5Eu3EwZFDrpGnw3fAQ.text: Much better than Famous Dave's. The long line tells the tale.

v-7M7Dvyxj7FPC0bkKFcKQ.text: Tried this place the other day, wasn't too bad but wasn't great, I decided to come here due to all the great reviews but the food was just okay. Although pricing was great and had a great food selection, everything was just average. I also didn't really care for their Tangy BBQ sauce and their corn on the cob wasn't crisp or sweet enough for me.

mn9L-6spPAl0uJOVPAUClQ.text: I honestly don't know what all the hype is about.  The turkey is pretty tasty, but other than that we were not impressed.  As other reviewers have stated, just trying to get the BBQ "sause" out of the bottle is irritating.  Casual is one thing, but I felt like I was eating in a barn somewhere.  Would get turkey or pork for carryout again, but that's about it.

7HRw1M1eBZsiRbNMcwTJOg.text: Came here for lunch for the 1st time...and the line was long.  Was briefed by the server...p/u your sides...pick your meat...tell them how much weight of meat you want...also get unlimited slices of bread (white/wheat).  Boom you got your meal.  So I figured...instead of getting the sandwich...I can just make my own with the bread they gave me.   Liked how they weighed all the meat before you.  1/2lb of brisket didn't seem like a lot in my basket...but seemed liked what everybody was getting in around me. So figured that was enough and if you eat it with their bread it'll fill you up.  Lean Brisket taste good...sauce was good...nothing that wowed me.  Wouldn't drive out of my way to get here.  Average BBQ joint.

spXRNrWUdqTe5KL8POlD3g.text: Food was ok, I had the brisket.  I think what my problem was that I was standing in line like I was in a school cafeteria and I got my meat served on wax paper. Guess I expected a little more or at least a plate.

E-_OsBBbOvgUcDmCNa-kpw.text: Just ate a Rudy's in Chandler.  Best BarbQ ever!  Linda K

D-Gz_IKFWtUqQ_9Ulq61Aw.text: Love this place where you get delicious food for a great price.  Been here tons of times and I have need had a bad meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. Front the indoor patio towards where you order

GeJmKctlqGt1zbj7OAEewA.text: Love the atmosphere. Love the little bar with all the pickled sides.   My favorite is their Baby Back ribs and Jalopeno sausages. Prime rib is good too but it gets cold too fast and it's not as good. I suggest asking them to heat up the bread.   Their sauce is also amazing but it is on the spicy/peppery side so if you're a fan of the sweet bbq sauce, just be warned.   Love their sweet tea and all the beer selection as well!

AJkZetOzvfU7h12kpKGwrg.text: OK...I have to be fair.  Normally I don't update a review in less than a year, but I was getting my camera lens repaired at a shop right behind Rudy's.  My wife wanted to give them another chance.  So here I am.  That alone wouldn't be enough to get a new review out of me, but they apparently addressed the problem I highlighted last time.  This time the brisket had a wonderful smoky flavor.  Not overpowering, but very distinctly present.  This is more like the Rudy's I knew a year or more ago.  I'd say today was a 4-star meal, but I won't give them that for two reasons.  First, inconsistency.  Six months ago their meat had no smoke flavor at all.  Six months before that it did, and today it did.  I'd like more consistency and reliability in the quality of the meal.  And second, there was a coal in my green chili stew.  They tried to say it was just a "burnt end".  No, it was a piece of burned wood.  I know the difference.  However, to their credit they offered to replace the stew and gave us a gift card to come back.  I have to give management credit when they try to make something right.  Despite that one bit of wood, their stew really is great.  Perhaps the best thing they do.  Good stuff.

MgMGrAv413l3IcWLcYgU6Q.text: The prime rib had good flavor on the outside middle had nothing.  For paying $20 for the serving it was very disappoint.  I didnt care for the pulled pork either.  But the brisket and Turkey were great ! Maybe depends on the cook ? Or how long it cooked for? For a $50 lunch we were disappointed

ZqsoAlG7T5HBmcutFBO6Qw.text: The best brisket I've had in Arizona! And the jalapeno links were just the right amount of spice. The coleslaw & potato salad are to be expected. Wouldn't say they're amazing, however they compliment the main dishes nicely. The sassy bbq is unbelievably delicious! Just found my new go-to bbq spot in Arizona!

TBxHt1ezIGuH7NOZhW3V3w.text: Brisket is good.  I just don't like the beans or Cole slaw here. Even though I am a huge Cole slaw and bean eater. The BQ sauce here I actually do not like. The cheapy Kraft BQ sauce at the store is better than here. It seems to have to much vinegar in it. The bottles to dispense the BQ sauce are hard to deal with. It's like they don't want you to use their sauce. Maybe that's a good thing. I was in the area and thought I would try it again. But to no surprise still the same.  All the meats are really great but the sauce and extras just don't set the tone for me.  I couldn't eat the beans. The BQ sauce has now upset the stomach. I know a lot of people like many things here but it doesn't cut the mustard with me or rather the sauce.

Bcdx6TywQWIekRisH_G9Qw.text: I work in the food service industry and don't Yelp much unless it's really worth it! Was sitting at the house watching Man vs Food and they were showing BBQ joints in the south. Of course that's where all the really good BBQ is, but a bit out of the way for a Tempe boy. None the less I really needed some good BBQ! Googled places near me and a good number came up, but Rudy's had a ton or reviews and high ratings. So, I'm off to Rudy's! It was well worth the drive in the AZ heat! The place is well set up and organized. A good menu with plenty of options. And the staff was very pleasant and helpful! I overheard the gentleman behind the counter helping the couple next to me and he was very courteous, explained how they do things and even offered them samples of a few things. The lady that helped me was super nice too! Anyways, I got a sausage, baby back ribs, a pulled pork sandwich, potato salad and coleslaw. Maybe a little overboard, but it all sounded good and I'm babysitting my dad while mom is out of town Everything was awesome and the portions were huge! The pulled pork sandwich was what I really went there for and it was awesome! Great smoked flavor and their sauce that you get on the side is super good as well! Anyone with a craving for good BBQ here in the valley needs to check out Rudy's!! Even if it's a bit of a drive for you, it's well worth it!!

fwMtdOpF-ubegEtWgD4jkw.text: I met up with my friends in Chandler to eat some BBQ. We got here at a little after 6 pm. As to be expected, the line was long. After waiting in line, we ordered a bunch of meats including pork ribs, brisket, sausage, creamed corn, potato salad, and a gallon of tea. I stuck with their sissy sauce as I had a marathon to run the next day and didn't want to risk any GI issues during the race. You can eat the meat with bread and pickles. My friends told me that their brisket was good and I can confirm that that was their best item. It was so good that we got back in line to order some more. The rest of the food was pretty decent.  The seating here is picnic style. After ordering your food, you'll need to find a place to sit down. Then grab some paper and napkins before you start eating. Afterwards you bus your own table.

photos.caption: Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. Pork ribs

Uc8-m_7nErrKkqJa9lVitw.text: A meat (chicken) and a side (the potato) is nearly $13 without a drink. I advised that my potato was cold and the manager said "I'd get you another one but it will be cold too". Whaaa? The chicken is $7 for one small edible piece of breast and then a waste on other fatty bits of the chicken. Used to come here often, won't be back, cold and overpriced. If you find yourself in San Antonio, the original Rudy's rocks.

J87eUxHS5pnZeMFpw4_mlg.text: I first discovered Rudy's back in 2006 when I was working in Texas.  Great BBQ at a gas station?!?!?!   Sign me up!!  I can multi-task.  Well, the location in Chandler doesn't have a gas station, which is fine with me.  I love the employees here.  They put up with all kinds of nonsense from oblivious customers and are always friendly and upbeat.    What it does have is some delicious smoked meat.  And very cold beers.  I think there are some sides, but I can't remember them because we go full-on carnivore when we eat there.    I swung in today during my least favorite time of day, the noon hour, but I was in the area, so I thought I'd get some brisket and sausage to go with some delicious smoked gouda I have at home.  The line was almost to the door, which is to be expected, but then I realized that near the front was a group of almost a dozen people, all together, clogging up the works.    My version of this morning's meeting:  "Where should we have lunch?"  11 voices chime in "RUDY'S!!!!"  1 voice squeaks out, "Whataburger."  "OK.  Rudy's it is.  Should we have them cater?"  "NO!!!"  "Should we call ahead?"    "NO!!!"  "Should we look at the menu ahead of time and figure out our orders so only one or two people are at the register?"  "HELL NO!!"  "Should we all go up to the register together, order separately, take all the time in the world, and clog the works up for everybody else?"  "YES!!!  Screw those assholes!"  I think some of that jagoffery I experienced in Nebraska followed me home.  There was some evidence of jagoffery in the parking lot too with a gray pickup and small trailer for a solar panel business taking up FOUR spots during the lunch hour.  Could have done with two.  Nope.  I'm taking four.    Jagoff.

photos.caption: Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. Stuffed breakfast taco with brisket and yep I dig the sissy &#34;sause&#34;.

2BwI6WRpyu0lhWJaifD_iA.text: This is the first time I've been to Rudys , it looked great inside I thought the prices we really inexpensive the food was good ! One of my sons had a brisket sandwich and it had a lot of fat on it that was a definite turn off so that's why I'm rating it a 3 . We tried the pudding they had for dessert banana and chocolate the banana was great !! I thought the music was great  overall I think they need to be aware of the fat and take it off the meat before they send it out !! I should have taken a picture of all the fat that came out of that sandwich it was a lot so I'm not sure if this is an every day occurrence or not but I will try them again  to see !

photos.caption: Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States

rVVkXtD0MmaXVr9jV50X6Q.text: brisket is always spot on  nuff said  i have always been a fan of rudys in austin texas and was excited when they came to az.  bbq was not very good when they first ooened but now it is really good.

LnrePV-34iWE1ZHUpHBiaw.text: When traveling from Tucson to Las Vegas or L.A., I needed a place to stop for lunch. I finally found the perfect spot right off the freeway in Chandler. This place was quick and the food was out of bounds. The meats have wonderful smokey flavors. I have tried the chicken, pulled pork and brisket. All were excellent! They offer a signature sauce that made it even more flavorful. Service was very friendly and if you are a first time visitor, a greeter will offer you some tips as soon as you walk in. The food was so delicious, my family and I returned multiple times in one week. The restaurant was very open with lots of seating and would be great for groups.

photos.caption: Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. Cold beer.
Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. Complimentary self-served veggie bar (salsa next to it, not shown).
Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. Half-chicken.

JvYjkK-DhZpU7qTZUM9zTQ.text: Delicious! Being from Texas this is my go to place for barbecue. The jumbo potatoes are awesome.

hlzUSljjn-k8G3RhsCQA3w.text: I have been to Rudy's a number of times and quite honestly i've never experienced as good of pork ribs anywhere else.  On top of that, the peach cobbler and Oreo pudding is incredible.  It's a dinner that will last you for days!

h-VttIwN88S3wH74BNkVTg.text: We've been going here ever since they opened. Their BBQ meat is delicious! The prime rib is my favorite. It's very casual dining; sometimes shared seating if all the picnic benches are full. Love that they sell their sauce in big bottles to take home!

9mNEdoPNdYID7yQbJgCCow.text: Let's start out with the disclaimer that I love great barbecue. I love a good smoke ring and charred bits of that taste in my mouth is heavenly. That being the case, I am also fairly critical of barbecue restaurants; especially when I have partaken in a feast of awesome barbecue at Rudy's original location off of Boerne Stage Road in San Antonio. This location in Chandler does not miss a beat.  We had the prime rib, moist brisket, and pork ribs. They all had that signature smokey taste and the meat was tender. The pork ribs didn't take much work to get the meat off the bone and the prime rib was on the rare side, just how I like it. Some people prefer to throw that signature sauce all over the place. I choose to poor it into one of their picnic boats and dip my meat in it.   For a side we had their great tasting cream corn. For those of you that scoff at creamed corn, this is not your subpar can of cream corn that you buy off the supermarket shelves. No, this was prepared well and the heavy cream concoction was sweet and, of course, creamy.   We left full and on our way out, we were informed by one of their cheerful and helpful servers that they serve breakfast tacos made to order and some more common variations in a grab-n-go bin. Looks we'll be trying that out tomorrow morning.   One thing that I do miss from the original store that was not carried over to this location is the smell of the smokers that soaks into your clothes and gives you a subtle reminder of the meal you enjoyed earlier that day.

photos.caption: Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. Main dining area.

XXMCNksyOX9A6zKDlMcaBg.text: It's not completely like back home (Tennessee) but it's dang close!  I ordered a stuffed potato (awesome price for what you get) with brisket.  It was awesome. My friend's pulled pork was already very sweet before any sauce.  Otherwise I'd give it five.

L-6WmSNa1_HsfWSissW9xA.text: Rudys is an amazing BBQ experience. Love their moist beef brisket. Their cream corn is to die for. I have been to the ones in Texas and this one didn't disappoint.

1hJYz72oe4fSxh_ZvvmdxA.text: Interesting place. Staff is warm and friendly. You get to sample items before you purchase them. The prime rib was excellent. The jalapeno sausage was even better. So much food I couldn't eat everything. Great for families and reasonably priced. I like the fact they weigh your meat so you know exactly how much you have. That's pretty cool.

2loe-t_7poSOuBlt29iHig.text: I really really REALLY love Rudy's.   I can't express enough how much I enjoy the service, the food and the overall experience from the moment you shut your car door to opening it back up again.   This location is amazing. I've been here every time I drive up to Phoenix from Tucson and will always continue to do so.   Never be afraid to stop here if you have a chance. Take a moment to read the board of food choices and always ask questions. They're really helpful and super fast at everything. You definitely have to try their bbq sauce (reg. vs sissy) it's such a nice experience.   P.S  Don't forget to sign up on their website a day or so in advance to get 10% off!

j3mLlSncOV92vVrAF15bqw.text: The baby back ribs were excellent. Chicken, sausages, corn, beans and chili were decent. They have a long way to go for sustainability. Desperately need metal cutlery. Aside from sustainability, metal is just way easier to eat BBQ with!  Bumped them from 3 to 4 stars. The owner followed up and is looking into the plastic vs metal cutlery. Effort matters on my book, so thank you!  I'd love to bring the team back often if that changes.

HioY0LjMdobvZSdl1IZdrw.text: My boyfriend and I tried out this place for an early dinner. It wasn't busy since it was a Thursday at about 4pm. Seemed like they had a lot of employees so it was staffed up.  Likes: they offer free samples  Brisket was tasty (I had the sandwich) Pork loin sandwich my boyfriend liked Self serve drinks  Good potato salad Ample dining space  Staff was nice and helpful   Dislikes: Picnic table seating and hard chairs Barbecue sauce (one was very sour and the other a bit spicy rather than tangy) also the bottles they were in were difficult to get the sauce out  Napkins are paper rather than soft  Sides are all a la cart and just sitting in a fridge so they were hard to see.   Overall it wasn't a bad experience however compared to smoking hot barbecue across the street I liked across the street better than this place. Mostly because of the atmosphere in the barbecue sauce to be honest. But if you're looking for a new barbecue place to try out it's at least worth a try for the brisket. And again they had friendly staff.

kzQXy6bnlx1V7-lpZCmR5w.text: Let me start out by saying that I'm not a huge meat eater. My husband recalled trying this place before and after a day of shopping this restaurant seemed to be on our way home. When you first enter you stand in line and grab the drinks you want to buy and order your food at the front of the line. There is a huge menu board that prices things by half a pound, but the man working there told us it is completely acceptable to purchase by quarter pound increments as well. We got some turkey, beef, sausages, and a potato salad. Overall things tasted pretty decent. I wasn't wowed by it, but again, you should take my review with a grain of salt since I'm not a huge bbq person. I liked the unique concept where they give you these large crates to hold your food instead of trays and you just spread everything out on a table to eat. You bus your own tables after eating. The environment seemed nice and the restaurant was very clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. Condiments

45XftUkCKjP4AzV15HCeiw.text: Going from three starts to two. I wanted to give this place another shot as I hoped the few other times I had their food might have been outliers. Went for the baby back ribs and was disappointed. The meat was very dry. You should not have to struggle with getting meat off of baby back ribs but that's exactly what happened. Also, the membrane was not removed from the underside of the cage. That's bad prep.

photos.caption: Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States

Wpu_Ex_Egd5jDJc-B6Qrfw.text: This place is always a favorite with my family. The brisket moist is a huge favorite. Don't come here expecting to be prim and proper. Your plate is wax paper! It absolutely full fills the dining experience. The food here is always amazing. It always smells amazing. They have a bar with onions, pickles and other goodies. They also have prepackaged bread and you can get as much as needed.  We always will keep coming back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States

V23ea-ioDcz7FXyAVEJc-Q.text: I'd like to say between the places I've traveled I'm not a connoisseur of BBQ's but I've had my fare share of the good and the bad.   So we heard the whole East Valley rave of this place. Rudy's stands out with its exceptional service and the amazing meat. With so much confidence that they are not shy in getting you to try out their sample platter of their menu. I call it sample platter because those portions that we got might as well be the appetizer to our meal.   Delen was patient and perky in getting us acquainted for our first visit and showing us what Rudy's has to offer. I'm embarrassed to say that we sampled almost half of their entire menu, and will be back to try more heh. Hands down my favorite by far is their renowned wet brisket and turkey. Turkey was a bit surprising for me at first, but take my word for it and give it a shot.   The place feels very laid back definitely a joint to come chill and relax with your buddies and pals who you don't mind slathering meat juice all over. Worth the hype, definitely worth a visit if your in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. 1/2 pound wet brisket, 1/2 pound baby back ribs, 1/2 sausage, new potatoes side

Yckd5gZAObcyDLTwvBZ7oA.text: Rudy's has been a favorite of mine for some time, even though it is a bit of a drive away from my house.  This morning I wanted to kick off a nice Labor Day weekend by taking my youngest to a special breakfast together.  He was skeptical, but I reminded him of his love of savory food.  He LOVED the made-to-order breakfast tacos!  He had a "crispy" breakfast taco with bacon, cheese and potato.  It was more than filling for him and it completely changed his mind.  I had 2 breakfast tacos - one crispy with brisket, egg, cheese and potato - the other non-crispy the same way except bacon instead of brisket.  Both were great, though I think I preferred the bacon to the brisket.  I have a feeling my boy will be campaigning me to go back for special breakfasts in the future...

li5cZd4Qw1dLff1YFc50MA.text: Prologue: My fiancee and I wanted to try something new for one of our recent Saturday evening dinner dates. I had noticed this restaurant several times previously when taking my vehicle for service nearby and so we decided to give it a try.  The Plot: We shared a half-pound of Baby Back Ribs, a half-pound of Turkey Breast, and a half-link of Regular Sausage, along with Potato Salad and Coleslaw.  The Scene: We arrived early on a Saturday evening, which was a good idea because the restaurant got quite busy during the time we were enjoying our meal.  The decor and layout of this restaurant was typical for country BBQ with several picnic tables set out in a large, open space.  The ribs were meaty, tasty, and fall-off-the-bone tender as one would expect.  The turkey was very tender and was sliced from a very good cut of the breast.  The sausage was plump, juicy, and made a great sandwich with the regular BBQ sauce. This was the standout of the meal for me.  The potato salad was a great example of the American style classic.  The condiments bar was well stocked with a nice variety of pickles, peppers, etc.  The Rest of the Story: The meats were warm when we got to our table but it would have been nice if they were still hot. The ribs were good but didn't have the dry rub flavor and texture I like. Next time I would try Pork Ribs instead of Baby Back Ribs. The turkey, though tender, was a little on the dry side. I believe it is possible for smoked turkey to be juicy. The coleslaw was completely unremarkable, I expect we could have done better at the deli counter at our local grocery store.  Epilogue: This is a nice place for families or groups to enjoy some good BBQ.  Photo Design By: Billie Z.

photos.caption: Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. Baby Back Ribs
Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. Turkey Breast

YkR4dCHj9qgIFYKG48XZMA.text: New all-time favorite BBQ spot and am so so happy that a friend recommended this joint. Such an amazing concept from start to finish! As soon as you enter the line to order you're greeted by large vessels filled with ice cold beverages that you can grab yourself. From there as you zig zag and near the counter there's slide door fridges with cold sides such as potato salad that you can also grab yourself. Once you get to the counter to place your order, you can see directly behind the cashier are butchers cutting up fresh meat! Unlike other BBQ joints where you order and then have to wait forever to cook, they have everything pre-made and cut to order!   My go to has been the moist brisket with a side of corn and/or chips with 2-4 slices of bread to make myself a delicious little brisket sandwich. From there I get myself some awesome condiments from the condiment bar, seat myself down on the picnic tables and feast my heart out. It's no frills, just good food, good vibes, and good times. Do yourself a favor and check it out!!

LUDBBP9B1s8IFMqk2dFhIQ.text: I love coming here for breakfast tacos.  It is great that they are all out in all the different types.  I really like the BBQ brisket taco.  The Rudy's sissy hot sauce makes a perfect combination for taste.  This is a standard stop for us on Saturday mornings.

HGfaGfu5UNMePT4pTn7vEA.text: Literally so good. Best service and fast!! Not much to say because the food speaks for its self!

photos.caption: Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. Spicy chopped beef with saus

k9oGeIEd-Gmh8hDCH9kcOw.text: I was pleasantly surprised with the overall vibe of Rudy's. The concept is executed well from start to finish, if you want some bbq and want to feel like you're at a family cookout, this spot will deliver.   When we first walked in we must have clearly looked lost because an employee greeted us and gave us a quick rundown. Everything is al a carte, meats come by the 1/2 pound. You walk by beverages in a glass bottle available for purchase on your way to the front, but they also have traditional soda machines as well.   There is a cooler near the register where you can grab cold sides (coleslaw, potato salad, etc) and desserts. Then you make your way to the register to order your meat and hot sides. They will weigh your meat in front of you on a scale and get everything you need together in a little crate thing. They also ask if you want any white or wheat bread. Service at the register is friendly as well.   After paying you can grab your drinks and they have another little bar area to self serve pickles, onions, etc plus silverware and napkins. It's open seating and most tables are long communal tables. There are sauces placed every so often down the tables for you to enjoy.   As for the food, it's pretty solid bbq. While my girlfriend was disappointed in no mac n cheese option, we grabbed a side of coleslaw, potato salad and corn on the cob. I got a 1/2 pound of pulled pork and she got a 1/2 pound of turkey. They recommend a 1/2 pound of meat per person but I was pretty full. if you get a few sides you could definitely split.   The pulled pork was to be expected, it was tender. The turkey was the best she has tried at any bbq place, not dry and flavorful. I tried both bbq sauces and wasn't impressed though.. this was my letdown of the meal. The sauce is super tangy and I usually can do with a touch more sweet with my bbq. Wasn't awful I've just had better and wasn't a fan.   The coleslaw and potato salad were as expected too. Nothing life changing but good solid sides.   The food is a solid 3.5 and the atmosphere boosts it to a 4. A fun bbq experience and really awesome staff. Bathrooms are nice and clean too. They also have a hand washing station outside the bathrooms if you get crazy trying to eat ribs or something.

photos.caption: Photo of Rudy's "Country Store" and Bar-B-Q - Chandler, AZ, United States. Turkey, pulled pork, coleslaw, potato salad, corn on the cob, white bread, pickles, rice krispy
